widget.translation[0].definitions[0].def: a small piece of equipment that you do not know the name for
widget.translation[0].definitions[1].def: used to refer to an imaginary product that a company might produce
widget.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: Company A produces 6,000 widgets a month at a unit price of $0.33.
widget.translation[0].definitions[2].def: a small piece of software used as part of a webpage, or on a mobile phone, that shows information or does other things in a way that is controlled by the user
widget.translation[1].definitions[0].def: any small piece of equipment, used especially to talk about something that you do not know the name of
widget.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: Rear-view mirrors are just the kind of widget that car makers could easily buy from cheap-labor plants in Asia.
widget.translation[1].definitions[1].def: an imaginary product that a company might produce
widget.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: If a retailer marks down a shelf of widgets to $ I.99 apiece from $4.99, it may sell more of them.
